Description: Conical jar-sealing: of pale brown clay with the pottery lid of the jar adhering to the base. The seal bears four impressed inscriptions. The surfaces are frim but worn and one of the inscriptions of is virtually invisible.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: W. M. F. Petrie, 'Royal Tombs of the Earliest Dynasties' I, pls.XXVI, 63; XXVII, 64; P. Kaplony, 'Die Inschriften der Ägyptischen Frühzeit III (Wiesbaden, 1964), pls.75, abb.278; 79, abb. 300A see also vols. I, 137 and II, 814, n.788; 1130, 1133.
